stories.headline: Bolt or Volt?
stories.bodyText:
The fastest 100-meter dash was 33.71 seconds — impressive for a hunk of wires, but still over 3x SLOWER than Usain Bolt’s human record.

The robots ran so awkwardly that some looked like your uncle jogging back to the car because he left the lights on.

stories.headline: Bear down
stories.bodyText:
Chicago opened its 2025 preseason by defeating Buffalo 38–0, a nationally televised shutout that marked Williams’ first game action with the Bears.

It was the Bears’ first preseason game under new head coach Ben Johnson, hired after Matt Eberflus was fired during the 2024 season.

stories.headline: Back in the saddle
stories.bodyText:
The Dodgers turned a one-game deficit into a two-game division lead and secured the season head-to-head tiebreaker after winning 8 of 10 against the Padres.

This was the first time in six weeks the Dodgers won three straight games — but it instantly reasserted their control over the division.

stories.headline: Notorious hothead melts down
stories.bodyText:
Robles has long been known as a fiery, sometimes volatile player — his bat toss after repeated HBPs shows the same inability to let things go that’s dogged him in the past.

Robles, once a top Nationals prospect, has had a career marked by highlight-reel plays and equally memorable blowups.

stories.headline: Just pay the dude
stories.bodyText:
Hendrickson, a four-time Pro Bowler with 17.5 sacks in each of the past two seasons, has yet to reach a contract resolution with Cincinnati.

Despite his dominance, the Bengals are hesitating to pay him — echoing a long history of the team pinching pennies.

stories.headline: Ryder Cup drama
stories.bodyText:
Bryson DeChambeau, the lone LIV Golf rep, muscled his way back onto Team USA by racking up points in majors, making his first Ryder Cup appearance since 2021.

Think of Bryson as the drama-filled “cast member who got kicked off in Season 1… only to storm back in Season 3."
